result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcal Miles Long was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland by the close of business Monday.
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
Consecutive to: to 20CM113

miscConds.notes: Undergo a Substance Abuse Assmt & comply with all treatment recommendations.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.

Def is to complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention as directed by the DOC. 
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ A.J.M. unless determined appropriate by the Department of Corrections with input of A.J.M after domestic violence programming is successfully completed EXCEPT if a restraining order is in effect.

timeConds.notes:
Granted work release under the terms set by the Sheriff.
Contact ACJ within 7 days to start serving sentence no later than 9 a.m. 11/13/22.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcal Miles Long

records.addlTxt: JOC

9:11 AM Defendant Marcal Miles Long in court.  Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video for Marcal Miles Long.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Cases 20CM113, 22CF63, 22CM22, and 22CT6.  Parties have agreement.  State has complied with victim rights, no response and no restitution request.  Def understands counts and penalties for cases.  Atty, def pleads NO CONTEST.  Atty, def admits acts of domestic abuse.  Files contain PLQ, understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NO CONTEST pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the criminal complaints, parties agree.  Court finds factual basis exists and finds def GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes statement.  See attached for Sentencing.
Offer to Settle - REVISED 6/6/2022
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:39 PM Defendant Marcal Miles Long in court.  Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video for Marcal Miles Long.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 20CM113, 22CF63, 22CM22, and 22CT6.  Atty is asking for pleas/sentencing.  Agreement for all cases.  Pleading to 5 charges.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:04 PM Defendant Marcal Miles Long appeared by video.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video for Marcal Miles Long.  20CM113,22CF63,22Cm22,22CT6-- 
22CF63-- Schd for a prelim, Atty comments will waive right to a prelim. Atty and def go in a break out room 2:08pm, Back on the record 2:11pm. Ct finds know and vol waives right to prelim. Ct finds PC the def com a fel in Ashland Co & bound over for argnmt.  State is filing info now, Atty is ready for argnment now. Waives reading of info, pleads NG, noted
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:31 PM Defendant Marcal Miles Long in court in person  with attorney Vincent Rust appring by ZOOM.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prelim was schd when atty could not make it. Atty asking for a prelim 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Def showed up in the court room at 1pm for his hearing that was schd for today at 11:30am. Ct advised the def that his hearing has been reschd and he is to appear 6/6/22 at 1pm
Scheduling conference on June 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:32 AM Defendant Marcal Miles Long not in court. Atty is not in his office today, is sick. State comments, rec'd email from atty that he would be home today because of a illness. Ct is not satisified that the def's non appr was on purpose. Ct is having his JA put cases back in intake for schd.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:24 PM - Defendant Marcal Miles Long in court.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video means for Defendant Marcal Miles Long  Rec'd copy compl, waives read, req PH dte set.  Parties may ZOOM for next dte/prov video or stip to identification.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
